title: How to Buy Vegan Food Online

steps.headline: Study the vegan food pyramid to get an idea of what a healthy vegan diet looks like.
steps.description: Changing your diet from eating meat, dairy or other products to a strictly vegan diet can put you at risk for deficiencies, if not done in a healthy way. You can visit chooseveg.com/vegan-food-pyramid.asp to view this pyramid.

steps.headline: Research the types of products that should be substituted for vegan alternatives.
steps.description: These include rennet, used to make cheese, honey, gelatin, red dye from the cochineal insect, as well as meat, eggs and dairy products. Other foods that often contain animal-derived ingredients include bread, barbecue sauce, wine, beer, maple syrup, margarine, flour tortillas, mayonnaise, many types of sugars and Worcestershire sauce.

steps.headline: Join the VegWeb community.
steps.description: This site offers "Vegan 101" tips, a community board and thousands of vegan recipes.

steps.headline: Visit your natural food store or supermarkets to find fresh produce.
steps.description: Fresh fruits and vegetables do not ship very well from an online supplier. Pick up bananas, avocados, leafy greens, fruits, frozen fruits and seasonal vegetables. Avocados and bananas are commonly substituted for baking products, mayonnaise, ice cream and more. They are excellent staples to have on hand.

steps.headline: Buy some processed foods in the supermarket, rather than ordering them online.
steps.description: Check in the natural section and always check labels. You should try to buy these vegan foods in a store because they are heavy and will add to shipping costs. Buy nut butters, such as almond, peanut, cashew and walnut butter, at the supermarket. Some supermarkets allow you to crush and make your own at the store, ensuring it is very fresh. Buy flax seed, walnut, canola and olive oil. These rich oils are essential for getting a good supply of omega 3 fatty acids. Buy non-dairy milk in cartons at the store. Most supermarkets carry soy, almond, coconut and rice milk. If you are unable to find them, however, you can order them in cases online. Buy canned foods such as black beans, tomatoes and chickpeas at the store.

steps.headline: Order bulk vegan products from Earth Shift Products.
steps.description: If you need to stock your vegan pantry with things like cacao, chia seeds, specialty flours, agave nectar or avocado oil, you can get these items in bulk and shipped almost anywhere.

steps.headline: Order processed foods, such as meat substitutes, sauces, diary substitutes, cookies and seasonal items from The Vegan Store or Vegan Essentials.
steps.description: You can find a variety of alternatives to enhance your vegan pantry and satisfy cravings.

steps.headline: Buy upscale vegan food products from Abe's Market.
steps.description: This online marketplace carries obscure items, such as marshmallows, chocolate sauce, candies, granola, pasta, crackers and dried fruit. They have all the items that are available in a delicatessen or specialty natural food store.

steps.headline: Visit Food Fight Grocery's site to invest in vegan junk food.
steps.description: You can find tastes such as nacho cheese, bacon, taco filling, sloppy Joe filling, gum and gummy bears. This site also has powders and supplements to enhance a vegan diet.

steps.headline: Find baked goods and candies at Allison's Gourmet.
steps.description: This site says all its products are vegan, fair-trade and organic. Choose this site if you need to send a gift basket, cake or specialty caramels for presents or your own celebrations.

steps.headline: Order whole vegan meals online from veggiebrothers.com.
steps.description: You can order meals for yourself or for large gatherings that are made by vegan chefs and delivered to your door. Although shopping exclusively through Veggie Brothers would be fairly expensive, it is great for active vegans and supplemental meals.

steps.headline: Order baking products from the Alternative Baking Company and the Sunflower Baking Company.
steps.description: While you can find baking substitutes in most online stores, these companies are best for dedicated vegan bakers who want all the options.

text: Vegan Pantry Planning Study the vegan food pyramid to get an idea of what a healthy vegan diet looks like. Changing your diet from eating meat, dairy or other products to a strictly vegan diet can put you at risk for deficiencies, if not done in a healthy way. You can visit chooseveg.com/vegan-food-pyramid.asp to view this pyramid. Research the types of products that should be substituted for vegan alternatives. These include rennet, used to make cheese, honey, gelatin, red dye from the cochineal insect, as well as meat, eggs and dairy products. Other foods that often contain animal-derived ingredients include bread, barbecue sauce, wine, beer, maple syrup, margarine, flour tortillas, mayonnaise, many types of sugars and Worcestershire sauce. Join the VegWeb community. This site offers "Vegan 101" tips, a community board and thousands of vegan recipes. Visit your natural food store or supermarkets to find fresh produce. Fresh fruits and vegetables do not ship very well from an online supplier. Pick up bananas, avocados, leafy greens, fruits, frozen fruits and seasonal vegetables. Avocados and bananas are commonly substituted for baking products, mayonnaise, ice cream and more. They are excellent staples to have on hand. Buy some processed foods in the supermarket, rather than ordering them online. Check in the natural section and always check labels. You should try to buy these vegan foods in a store because they are heavy and will add to shipping costs. Buy nut butters, such as almond, peanut, cashew and walnut butter, at the supermarket. Some supermarkets allow you to crush and make your own at the store, ensuring it is very fresh. Buy flax seed, walnut, canola and olive oil. These rich oils are essential for getting a good supply of omega 3 fatty acids. Buy non-dairy milk in cartons at the store. Most supermarkets carry soy, almond, coconut and rice milk. If you are unable to find them, however, you can order them in cases online. Buy canned foods such as black beans, tomatoes and chickpeas at the store. Online Vegan Merchants Order bulk vegan products from Earth Shift Products. If you need to stock your vegan pantry with things like cacao, chia seeds, specialty flours, agave nectar or avocado oil, you can get these items in bulk and shipped almost anywhere. Order processed foods, such as meat substitutes, sauces, diary substitutes, cookies and seasonal items from The Vegan Store or Vegan Essentials. You can find a variety of alternatives to enhance your vegan pantry and satisfy cravings. Buy upscale vegan food products from Abe's Market. This online marketplace carries obscure items, such as marshmallows, chocolate sauce, candies, granola, pasta, crackers and dried fruit. They have all the items that are available in a delicatessen or specialty natural food store. Visit Food Fight Grocery's site to invest in vegan junk food. You can find tastes such as nacho cheese, bacon, taco filling, sloppy Joe filling, gum and gummy bears. This site also has powders and supplements to enhance a vegan diet. Find baked goods and candies at Allison's Gourmet. This site says all its products are vegan, fair-trade and organic. Choose this site if you need to send a gift basket, cake or specialty caramels for presents or your own celebrations. Order whole vegan meals online from veggiebrothers.com. You can order meals for yourself or for large gatherings that are made by vegan chefs and delivered to your door. Although shopping exclusively through Veggie Brothers would be fairly expensive, it is great for active vegans and supplemental meals. Order baking products from the Alternative Baking Company and the Sunflower Baking Company. While you can find baking substitutes in most online stores, these companies are best for dedicated vegan bakers who want all the options.
